intro: Anthemis rhodensis subsp. rhodensis, commonly known as the Greek tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit and features narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellow to golden-orange composite flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
